channel.title: Trie on Dmytro's Blog

item.title: DSA - Trie
item.description: What is a Trie? A Trie is a data structure usually called a “prefix tree,” often represented as a nested tree of dictionaries where each key is a character that maps to the next character in a word. Let’s look at some examples of a Trie. The Trie consists of two main classes: the TrieNode class and the Trie class. TrieNode The TrieNode class has two properties: children - a property that represents all characters in a given word and points to the next character.
